tags.name: zui-shell
tags.description: The Shell wraps around all of our applications and provides suite level consistencies, branding, and common functionality. This element, in particular, wraps all `<zui-shell>` custom sub-elements.

attributes.name: app-name
attributes.description: (Optional) The user-friendly name for this application; only applicable to anchor solutions and Client Cloud

properties.name: appName
properties.description: (Optional) The user-friendly name for this application; only applicable to anchor solutions and Client Cloud

slots.description: Default slot; all elements without a declared slot will be assigned to this slot. Recommended for slotting in `<zui-shell-topbar>`, `<zui-shell-nav>`, `<zui-shell-content>`, and `<zui-shell-footer>` only

tags.name: zui-shell-topbar
tags.description: There are two parts to the topbar: global and app. The top white bar is our global topbar, which has Zywave branding and includes global functionality. The bottom colored bar is our app bar (aka branding bar), which is tailored to the application or Cloud the user is viewing. Sometimes it is branded with the product name if not part of a Cloud. Global search, user information `<zui-shell-user>`, and the apps launchpad `<zui-shell-apps>` are all housed in this element.

attributes.name: no-appbar
attributes.description: (Optional) To hide the app bar and only show the global topbar; mainly for anchor solutions and Client Cloud

attributes.name: no-scroll-animation
attributes.description:
(Optional) To opt out of the topbar's off-screen scrolling animation.
Internet Explorer 11 does not include this animation

attributes.name: search-open
attributes.description: Indicates whether global search is available and open on mobile

properties.name: noAppBar
properties.description: (Optional) To hide the app bar and only show the global topbar; mainly for anchor solutions and Client Cloud

properties.name: noScrollAnimation
properties.description:
(Optional) To opt out of the topbar's off-screen scrolling animation.
Internet Explorer 11 does not include this animation

properties.name: searchOpen
properties.description: Indicates whether global search is available and open on mobile

events.name: topbarheightchange
events.description: fired when user scrolls down from the top of the page, or scrolls up when not at the top of the page

slots.description: Default slot; not recommended for use in `<zui-shell-topbar>`. Please use one of the assigned slots for all purposes!

slots.name: apps
slots.description: For slotting in the `<zui-shell-apps>` element; should not be used with the `logo` slot

slots.name: logo
slots.description: For slotting in a logo if not slotting in `<zui-shell-apps>`; should not be used with the `apps` slot because it has its own way to handle logos

slots.name: search
slots.description: For slotting in a search component such as `<zui-search>`

cssProperties.name: --zui-shell-topbar-app-opacity
cssProperties.description: App bar opacity for controlling the visiblity of the current application's name when set for anchor solutions; only applicable to anchor solutions and Client Cloud

cssProperties.name: --zui-shell-topbar-app-height
cssProperties.description: Height of the `<zui-shell-topbar>` app bar (colored bar) for anchor solutions; only applicable to anchor solutions and Client Cloud

cssProperties.name: --zui-shell-topbar-app-height-collapsed
cssProperties.description: Collapsed height of the `<zui-shell-topbar>` app bar (colored bar) for anchor solutions when topbar scrolling animation is enabled; only applicable to anchor solutions and Client Cloud

cssProperties.name: --zui-shell-topbar-global-color
cssProperties.description: Background color of the `<zui-shell-topbar>` global topbar

tags.name: zui-shell-apps
tags.description: `<zui-shell-apps>` is our apps launchpad and is a global topbar feature. This is the primary method for jumping from one anchor solution to another. Consumers should set this up to only list products the user has access to. When adding this element, be sure to set its assigned slot to `apps` so it appears in the proper place in `<zui-shell-topbar>`.

attributes.name: app-header
attributes.description: Heading for the apps dropdown

attributes.name: all-apps-url
attributes.description:
(Optional) Link to view all apps in a separate location.
Set this property if you want the "See all" links
to appear at the bottom of your apps list.

attributes.name: all-apps-text
attributes.description:
(Optional) Text for the link to view all apps in a separate location.
Will not show up if `all-apps-url` is not set.

attributes.name: open
attributes.description: Set to true when the dropdown list of anchor solutions is visible

properties.name: appHeader
properties.description: Heading for the apps dropdown

properties.name: allAppsUrl
properties.description:
(Optional) Link to view all apps in a separate location.
Set this property if you want the "See all" links
to appear at the bottom of your apps list.

properties.name: allAppsText
properties.description:
(Optional) Text for the link to view all apps in a separate location.
Will not show up if `all-apps-url` is not set.

properties.name: open
properties.description: Set to true when the dropdown list of anchor solutions is visible

slots.description: Default slot; list of all anchor solutions will be placed in here

slots.name: logo
slots.description: Assign logo elements or the default Zywave logo `<zui-logo>` to this slot for proper brand placement

tags.name: zui-shell-apps-item
tags.description: Child element of `<zui-shell-apps>` that renders into a link for each product the user has access to.

attributes.name: name
attributes.description: Name of the application

attributes.name: description
attributes.description: (Optional) Description of the application

attributes.name: url
attributes.description: URL to the application

attributes.name: target
attributes.description: (Optional) Specify where to open the link; default opens in a new tab

properties.name: name
properties.description: Name of the application

properties.name: description
properties.description: (Optional) Description of the application

properties.name: url
properties.description: URL to the application

properties.name: target
properties.description: (Optional) Specify where to open the link; default opens in a new tab

tags.name: zui-shell-nav
tags.description: The Shell collapsible side nav that houses the application's primary navigation. On medium screen sizes, the side nav automatically collapses to give users more screen real estate. Users can choose to expand it if they prefer.

attributes.name: open
attributes.description: Indicates whether the side nav is open or not on mobile

attributes.name: collapsed
attributes.description: Indicates when the side nav is collapsed

attributes.name: collapse-label
attributes.description: (Optional) For customizing the text for the collapse button at the bottom of the side nav

properties.name: open
properties.description: Indicates whether the side nav is open or not on mobile

properties.name: collapsed
properties.description: Indicates when the side nav is collapsed

properties.name: collapseLabel
properties.description: (Optional) For customizing the text for the collapse button at the bottom of the side nav

events.name: navcollapsechange
events.description: fired when nav is collapsed or expanded

slots.description: Default slot; recommended for slotting in `<zui-shell-nav-item>`

tags.name: zui-shell-nav-item
tags.description: Child element of `<zui-shell-nav>` that renders into a link. Top-level menu items must be accompanied by an icon. Children menu items do not need an icon.

attributes.name: expanded
attributes.description: This property becomes `true` when `<zui-shell-nav-item>` has children items and is expanded. All parent menu items are collapsed by default

attributes.name: subnav
attributes.description: This property becomes `true` when there are more than one anchor tag in `<zui-shell-nav-item>`

properties.name: expanded
properties.description: This property becomes `true` when `<zui-shell-nav-item>` has children items and is expanded. All parent menu items are collapsed by default

properties.name: subnav
properties.description: This property becomes `true` when there are more than one anchor tag in `<zui-shell-nav-item>`

events.name: navitemclick
events.description: Custom event fired when `<zui-shell-nav-item>` is clicked

slots.description: Default slot; top-level menu items will automatically be placed in this slot

slots.name: icon
slots.description: Required slot for top-level menu item's icon placement

slots.name: subnav
slots.description: Slot for children menu-items that is automatically set when there are more than one anchor tag; consumers do not have to assign elements to this slot

cssProperties.name: --zui-shell-nav-active-color
cssProperties.description: Text color of an active `<zui-shell-nav-item>` when you are currently in that section or page

tags.name: zui-shell-footer
tags.description: The footer is the small section at the bottom of each page that contains things like the privacy and cookie policies, and other legal and trademark information.

slots.description: Default slot; all privacy and cookie policies, and other legal and trademark information will be placed in here

tags.name: zui-shell-content
tags.description: Content area that wraps all information for applications.

slots.description: Default slot; all application content will be placed in here

tags.name: zui-shell-user
tags.description: Topbar feature that encompasses information about the User Principle, User Profile, impersonation, and notifications.

attributes.name: given-name
attributes.description: The first name of the user. It should be set to the `given_name` claim of the user principal. This may not yet be available on some principals, but will be back filled with profile information by an upcoming auth release. This component gracefully falls back to username.

attributes.name: family-name
attributes.description: The last name of the user. It should be set to the `family_name` claim of the user principal. This may not yet be available on some principals, but will be back filled with profile information by an upcoming auth release. This component gracefully falls back to username.

attributes.name: profile-name
attributes.description: This is the display name of the profile in context and will vary from profile type to profile type.

attributes.name: profile-detail
attributes.description: This is additional profile information displayed as subtext. It should generally represent the location and/or profile name. You may want to make this a function to ensure a clean rendering with the assumption of missing claims.

attributes.name: username
attributes.description: This is the username of the user. It should be set to the `preferred_username` claim of the user principal.

attributes.name: manage-user-url
attributes.description: This is a URL to user self service tool. It should be set to `https://profiles.zywave.com` per environment.

attributes.name: logout-user-url
attributes.description: This is a URL to the logout page of the application.

attributes.name: manage-profile-url
attributes.description: This is a URL to the proper edit page for the profile in context.

attributes.name: switch-profile-url
attributes.description: This is a URL to the local switch profile path. **This should only be set if the user has multiple contextual profiles available.**

attributes.name: avatar
attributes.description: This is a URI of the avatar of the user. It should be set to the "picture" claim of the user principal.

attributes.name: user-header
attributes.description: This is the text that appears above the user section. Should be set to localized "User".

attributes.name: profile-header
attributes.description: This is the text that appears above the profile section. Should be set to localized phrase representing the profile type such as "Agency Profile", "Employer Profile" or just simply "Profile".

attributes.name: manage-user-text
attributes.description: This is the text that appears as the manage user link. Should be set to localized "Manage User".

attributes.name: logout-user-text
attributes.description: This is the text that appears as the logout user link. Should be set to localized "Logout".

attributes.name: manage-profile-text
attributes.description: This is the text that appears as the manage profile link. Should be set to localized "Manage Profile".

attributes.name: switch-profile-text
attributes.description: This is the text that appears as the switch profile link. Should be set to localized "Switch".

attributes.name: open
attributes.description: Boolean for when the user dropdown is open.

attributes.name: notification-count
attributes.description: This is the how many unread notifications the user/profile has. Get by calling Shared.Notifications Service.

attributes.name: notification-header
attributes.description: This is the text that appears above the notification section.

attributes.name: notification-title
attributes.description: This is the text that appears after the notification count in profile section.

attributes.name: no-notification-title
attributes.description: This is the text that appears when there are no new notifications in the notifications section of the user dropdown.

attributes.name: view-notifications-text
attributes.description: This is the text that appears as the notification inbox link.

attributes.name: view-notifications-url
attributes.description: This is a URL to the notification inbox (ex: `dev-zh.zywave.com/notifications/inbox`).

attributes.name: impersonating
attributes.description: This property is required for all the impersonation properties to work and show.

attributes.name: impersonating-action
attributes.description: Text for the current user impersonating another profile.

attributes.name: impersonating-profile-name
attributes.description: Name of the profile the current user is impersonating.

attributes.name: impersonating-given-name
attributes.description: First name of the user associated with the profile the current user is impersonating.

attributes.name: impersonating-family-name
attributes.description: Last name of the user associated with the profile the current user is impersonating.

attributes.name: unauthenticated
attributes.description: Indicates that the user is currently unauthenticated, and should be given access to login.

attributes.name: login-user-text
attributes.description: This is the text that displays to unauthenticated users to login.

attributes.name: login-user-url
attributes.description: The url where unauthenticated users can be redirected to login.

properties.name: givenName
properties.description: The first name of the user. It should be set to the `given_name` claim of the user principal. This may not yet be available on some principals, but will be back filled with profile information by an upcoming auth release. This component gracefully falls back to username.

properties.name: familyName
properties.description: The last name of the user. It should be set to the `family_name` claim of the user principal. This may not yet be available on some principals, but will be back filled with profile information by an upcoming auth release. This component gracefully falls back to username.

properties.description: This is a URL to the proper edit page for the profile in context.

properties.name: avatar
properties.description: This is a URI of the avatar of the user. It should be set to the "picture" claim of the user principal.

properties.name: userHeader
properties.description: This is the text that appears above the user section. Should be set to localized "User".

properties.name: profileHeader
properties.description: This is the text that appears above the profile section. Should be set to localized phrase representing the profile type such as "Agency Profile", "Employer Profile" or just simply "Profile".

properties.name: manageUserText
properties.description: This is the text that appears as the manage user link. Should be set to localized "Manage User".

properties.name: logoutUserText
properties.description: This is the text that appears as the logout user link. Should be set to localized "Logout".

properties.name: manageProfileText
properties.description: This is the text that appears as the manage profile link. Should be set to localized "Manage Profile".

properties.name: switchProfileText
properties.description: This is the text that appears as the switch profile link. Should be set to localized "Switch".

properties.name: open
properties.description: Boolean for when the user dropdown is open.

properties.name: notificationCount
properties.description: This is the how many unread notifications the user/profile has. Get by calling Shared.Notifications Service.

properties.name: notificationHeader
properties.description: This is the text that appears above the notification section.

properties.name: viewNotificationTitle
properties.description: This is the text that appears after the notification count in profile section.

properties.name: noNotificationTitle
properties.description: This is the text that appears when there are no new notifications in the notifications section of the user dropdown.

properties.name: viewNotificationText
properties.description: This is the text that appears as the notification inbox link.

properties.name: viewNotificationUrl
properties.description: This is a URL to the notification inbox (ex: `dev-zh.zywave.com/notifications/inbox`).

properties.name: impersonating
properties.description: This property is required for all the impersonation properties to work and show.

properties.name: impersonatingAction
properties.description: Text for the current user impersonating another profile.

properties.name: impersonatingProfileName
properties.description: Name of the profile the current user is impersonating.

properties.name: impersonatingGivenName
properties.description: First name of the user associated with the profile the current user is impersonating.

properties.name: impersonatingFamilyName
properties.description: Last name of the user associated with the profile the current user is impersonating.

properties.name: unauthenticated
properties.description: Indicates that the user is currently unauthenticated, and should be given access to login.

properties.name: loginUserText
properties.description: This is the text that displays to unauthenticated users to login.

properties.name: loginUserUrl
properties.description: The url where unauthenticated users can be redirected to login.

properties.name: displayName
properties.description: Display name of the current user principal

properties.name: initials
properties.description: Initials of the current user principal

properties.name: impersonatingDisplayName
properties.description: Display name of the user profile being impersonated

cssProperties.name: --zui-shell-user-avatar-background
cssProperties.description: Background color of the avatar when user principle initials are used to represent the current logged in user

cssProperties.name: --zui-shell-user-avatar
cssProperties.description: Icon/text color of the principal user initials in the avatar

cssProperties.name: --zui-shell-profile-avatar-background
cssProperties.description: Background color of the icon that represents the profile in context

cssProperties.name: --zui-shell-profile-avatar-color
cssProperties.description: Icon/text color of the profile in context
